证据片段: Phase transformations of zirconium alloys in the solid state are essentially governed by a few general tendencies. The high temperature $\beta ( \mathtt { b c c } )$ phase has the tendency to transform into the orthohexagonal structure, the orthorhombic distortion from the hexagonal symmetry depending on the extent of supersaturation with respect to $\beta$ -stabilizing alloying elements.
